TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public interface auto ansi abstract Visualizer/IOnDataCaptureListener implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: The OnDataCaptureListener interface defines methods called by the Visualizer to periodically update the audio visualization capture.

remarks.para: The OnDataCaptureListener interface defines methods called by the Visualizer to periodically update the audio visualization capture. The client application can implement this interface and register the listener with the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void OnFftDataCapture (Android.Media.Audiofx.Visualizer visualizer, byte[] fft, int samplingRate);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnFftDataCapture(class Android.Media.Audiofx.Visualizer visualizer, unsigned int8[] fft, int32 samplingRate) cil managed

Docs.param: Visualizer object on which the listener is registered.
array of bytes containing the frequency representation.
sampling rate of the audio visualized.
Docs.summary: Method called when a new frequency capture is available.

remarks.para: Method called when a new frequency capture is available.

Data in the fft buffer is valid only within the scope of the callback. Applications which needs access to the fft data after returning from the callback should make a copy of the data instead of holding a reference.

MemberSignature.Value: public void OnWaveFormDataCapture (Android.Media.Audiofx.Visualizer visualizer, byte[] waveform, int samplingRate);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnWaveFormDataCapture(class Android.Media.Audiofx.Visualizer visualizer, unsigned int8[] waveform, int32 samplingRate) cil managed

Docs.param: Visualizer object on which the listener is registered.
array of bytes containing the waveform representation.
sampling rate of the audio visualized.
Docs.summary: Method called when a new waveform capture is available.

remarks.para: Method called when a new waveform capture is available.

Data in the waveform buffer is valid only within the scope of the callback. Applications which needs access to the waveform data after returning from the callback should make a copy of the data instead of holding a reference.
